message: I didn't think this is worth a thread on HN (yet), but if anyone is interested. I made a chrome extension to give HN a new look: http://jarqu.es/dev/hn/hackernews.crx

Honestly I was hesitant to install this because you didn't even say what it is/does, but I did anyway! Looks good. Here's a screenshot for posterity: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2067384/Screenshots/2o.png
Short description of what this extension does: makes HN "prettier" and more "readable."

BTW, I actually tweeted earlier today that I was looking for a Chrome extension that acted like an HN dashboard, i.e., 1) allows me to follow HN users, 2) allows me to subscribe to threads, 3) emails notifications/displays in a feed replies to my comments, among other things.
Yeah, sorry about not posting a screenshot! Was thinking about it. I was thinking of extending it even more. Bring up options when you hit a button or keystroke.
You should post a screenshot so we can make up our minds without installing something. :)
Looks good! I love the new header. Not 100% sure about the typeface you've chosen for the titles though
Thanks ZoFrex! Yeah I'm still not convinced it's the best font, still experimenting with it.
After using this for about a day now, I actually feel that the fonts chosen make HN less readable. Mostly, they prevent easy scanning of text. But additionally landmarking is more difficult as well.

By fonts, I mean everything related to the type: faces, sizes, kerning, line height. But you seem to be on the right track. Still, I do wonder if the face itself even needs to be changed, c.f. Daring Fireball.
@thetylerhayes I do agree with you. I'm still experimenting with serif and sans-serif typefaces with different styles..
